name: Tartaglia
desc: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe." His name is highly feared on the battlefield.

value.name: A Prize Catch
value.desc: Tartaglia's specialty. It looks like a trapped beast floundering in an ocean of blood, its death throes an inaudible scream... But Tartaglia smiles and explains that this is something he fished out of the sea, with some products from his homeland on the side.

value.name: Tartaglia
value.desc:
"Childe" Tartaglia

Should this table be considered a battlefield, then may the strongest claim the win.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>November 4, 2020</color>
"One can trust him, but one ought not get too attached. He has unusual tastes when it comes to combat - the encounters he craves the most being those that bring him closest to his own demise." — The cautious counsel of fellow Harbinger, Pulcinella
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/75641</color>

<color=#ffd780>November 11, 2020</color>
"If your plan is to get the best of me... I'm looking forward to watching you try."
He is an amiable ally and a cold-blooded killer — and his name is Tartaglia!
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/81259</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2021</color>
Haha, what a great sparring session! I didn't expect your martial arts to have improved so much.
This makes me more excited about our future duels!
I feel hungry after such a good fight. You?
If you don't have any other plans, how about coming to try my cooking today?
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/573710</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2022</color>
"Teucer mentioned you in his letter, Traveler."
"Receiving a letter from family and being in the company of my friends, what a great day!"
"Yes, yes, we got it, Tartaglia. Come and help us out here!"
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/6101474</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2022</color>
There you are, comrade. Faster than I expected!
I see you haven't been neglecting your practice... I can tell by the look in your eyes.
Here, take this. It's a Mr. Cyclops plushie from Teucer. He's looking forward to playing with you again someday.
It's colder in Snezhnaya than in Liyue, so remember to dress warmly then!
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/6101475</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2023</color>
"Not bad! A duel is all I could have wished for on my birthday."
"Oh? You mean this is my actual present?"
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/20176368</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2023</color>
"Hmm? This album... must be a gift from my traveling companion."
"It's been such a long time. I wonder when we'll meet again..."
"...Teucer! Come take a look at this youkai picture book, you'll love it."
"Yay, storytime! Mr. Cyclops wants to listen too!"
"Ahaha, alright then. Let's start from the beginning..."
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/20176380</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2024</color>
"Hey, comrade! Ready for another exhilarating battle?"
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/31264599</color>

<color=#ffd780>July 20, 2024</color>
—Hey, comrade, you can't zone out during a snowball fight!
Hmm? That snowman over there? Haha, I made it while waiting for you.
Snowy days really make me feel right at home. Just standing in the snow puts me in a better mood.
Are you cold? Wanna borrow my scarf?
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/31264600</color>

<color=#ffd780>March 14, 2021</color>
Shh!
This gift won't be as special if too many people know of it.
Well then, open it up and have a look. Yes, right now — I'll have you know that I've spent several sleepless nights wondering whether you'll like it.
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/242675</color>

<color=#ffd780>April 8, 2021</color>
A new Fatui recruit has arrived in Liyue for a special assignment at the request of the 11th Harbinger,
Childe — who seems somewhat different from the mighty Harbinger that the recruit originally had in mind...
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/288149</color>

<color=#ffd780>October 31, 2021</color>
Pumpkins, Ghosts, Bats...What is happening?
Everyone across Teyvat has suddenly changed their attire.
I wonder how Hilichurls are dressed during this time...
Click image to view full wallpaper
<color=#80c0ff>X:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/x.com/Paimon2theMoon/status/1454659396512796678</color>
Version 2.2 - Into the Perilous Labyrinth of Fog

<color=#ffd780>February 20, 2023</color>
<color=#ece5d8>[Translated from Russian]</color>
“Teucer, go wash your hands, we’ll be eating soon!”
"Wow... I'm coming! My brother is the best!"
<color=#80c0ff>X:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/x.com/RUGenshinImpact/status/1627519674752671744</color>

<color=#ffd780>October 8, 2023</color>
Click image to view full wallpaper
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/22183092</color>

<color=#ffd780>March 11, 2024</color>
"Oh... The table is finally set!"
"You're great, brother! Everything is so delicious!.."
"Ha-ha-ha! Wait a little, Teucer. When everyone is here, then we'll start!"
<color=#80c0ff>X:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/x.com/RUGenshinImpact/status/1767045294644924701</color>

<color=#ffd780>February 25, 2025</color>
"Freminet, is the festive dinner ready yet? It looks delicious, your cooking skills have improved a lot."
"Yes, "Father"... I've improved the recipes based on the opinions of my brothers and sisters."
"An impressive feast! It looks like my help won't be needed today!"
<color=#ffacff>VK:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/vk.com/wall-183293188_2068607</color>

<color=#ffd780>June 16, 2021</color>
<color=#ece5d8>[Translated from Chinese]</color>
Hello travelers, the number of fans at the official Bilibili of Genshin Impact has exceeded 6 million.
<color=#80c0ff>Bilibili:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.bilibili.com/opus/536777509346871608</color>

<color=#ffd780>January 16, 2020</color>
Located in the east of Teyvat, Liyue is a bountiful harbor with unique architectural style, bountiful landscape and rich natural heritage. Travelers, now it's time for you to explore and uncover the many mysteries that shroud this Eastern fantasy city.
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/129</color>

<color=#ffd780>August 13, 2023</color>
Neither dwell on your regrets, nor fret over what the future holds.
This melody has witnessed all seasons and climes, settling at last like morning dew in a dream.
Melodies of an Endless Journey will soon resound anew...
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

<color=#ffd780>December 8, 2023</color>
<color=#ece5d8>[Translated from Japanese]</color>
Genshin Impact × Tokyo Skytree collaboration event "~ Guided by the Spirit of Thunder ~" to be held!
<color=#80c0ff>X:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/x.com/genshin_7/status/1733111685857390798</color>

<color=#ffd780>December 26, 2023</color>
<color=#ece5d8>[Translated from Chinese]</color>
Dear Travelers,
The Xiaomi Mi Band 8 Pro Genshin Impact customized edition will be available for pre-sale starting at 12:00 on December 30!
<color=#ffacff>Miyoushe (CN HoYoLAB):</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.miyoushe.com/ys/article/46961043</color>

Meet Tartaglia — the cunning Snezhnayan whose unpredictable personality keeps people guessing his every move.
Don't be under any illusion as to what he might be thinking or what his intentions are. Just remember this: Behind that innocent, childlike exterior lies a finely honed instrument of war.

<color=#ffd780>About Skirk</color>
It's been years since I last saw my master. I should hope that next we meet, I'll at least be able to force her to use both hands to beat me...

customize.name: Zhongli
customize.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.

customize.text: Tartaglia and Zhongli are friends. Tartaglia often comes to Zhongli's aid for financial support.

<color=#ffd780>About Zhongli: Pondering</color>
There's far more to that man than meets the eye. As for the extent of his power... lots to look forward to, I think.
<color=#ffd780>About Zhongli: Challenge</color>
Tell me, how has Mr. Zhongli been lately? Not bad, you say? Seems he's had no problem acclimating to "mortal" life. Hmph, he sure had me fooled. Such a fiasco mustn't be so easily forgiven! The only way to reconciliation is fierce combat! What do you mean I'm no match for him? Hahaha...
<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia: Composed</color>
That rascal from Snezhnaya has yet to depart from Liyue? Heh, no matter. Just let me know if he gives you any trouble. I shall deal with the matter swiftly.
<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia: Drinks</color>
It's said that Childe and his reputation have yet again stirred up waves among the inner ranks of the Fatui. Knowing his type, he will be sure to swiftly depose anyone who dares to challenge his actions. Hmm... Come to think of it, there will be a lot of interesting news to be heard the next time we gather for drinks. Care to join me when the time comes, Traveler?
Tsaritsa is the Cryo Archon who presides over Tartaglia's home nation of Snezhnaya. He worships her.

<color=#ffd780>About Tsaritsa</color>
Her Royal Highness the Tsaritsa is actually a gentle soul. Too gentle, in fact, and that's why she had to harden herself. Likewise, she declared war against the whole world only because she dreams of peace. And because she made an enemy of the world, I had the chance to become acquainted with you.

<color=#ffd780>About Varka</color>
Varka? Just the thought of one day going head-to-head with him in combat, the fabled Knight of Boreas himself, titan of the Knights of Favonius... It makes me buzz with excitement. It's a beautiful life we live in this world.

<color=#ffd780>About The Jester</color>
He was the first ever Fatui Harbinger, and today he is our leader. He only appears on important occasions. As for his accomplishments... To be honest, I don't really care. I owe my loyalty and devotion to the Tsaritsa, no one else.
Tartaglia wants The Captain to respect him.

<color=#ffd780>About The Captain</color>
I've seen him in battle before, and oh what a sight it was. Perhaps I'm ranked too low for him to notice me right now. Well, he may not recognize my strengths yet, but one day, I'll show him what I'm made of.
Tartaglia thinks The Captain is a little weird.

<color=#ffd780>About The Doctor</color>
I heard that he took segments of himself at different ages, made prostheses out of them, and assigned different tasks to each one. I know... all my comrades are a little weird. Well, come to think of it, if I met another version of myself... Hah, we'd have to fight then and there to decide which one of us gets to survive.
Tartaglia is cautious of Damselette due to her high ranking within the Fatui Harbingers.

<color=#ffd780>About Damselette</color>
The Fatui Harbingers are ranked by strength, and I have no idea why that girl is No. 3. I'd test my skills with every Harbinger who ranks above me if I had the chance, but when it comes to her... something just doesn't feel right. Anyway, you should be careful around her.
Tartaglia dislikes The Knave as he believes she would be willing to betray the Tsaritsa.

<color=#ffd780>About The Knave</color>
Look, I've got nothing against people who have their own agendas — I myself joined the Fatui to get more experience in combat. But I don't like her at all. If she stood to benefit from betraying others, she'd turn against the Tsaritsa in a heartbeat. There isn't a sane bone in her body.
The Rooster looks after Tartaglia's siblings when he is away from Snezhnaya.

<color=#ffd780>About The Rooster</color>
I don't know what his motivations could be, but he seems genuine about wanting to help me. He treats me just like family — Tonia and Teucer are always telling me about the pastries and other gifts he brings them when they write. So while I've been away from Snezhnaya, he's kept his promise to take care of my family.
Tartaglia is not sure why he annoys Marionette.

<color=#ffd780>About Marionette</color>
She always seems engrossed in her research. Hmm... I wonder if those machines have anything to do with her? Anyway, I've only met her a few times, but every time she looked like she wanted to murder me. I have no idea what I possibly could have done to annoy her, though.
Tartaglia does not know Regrator well.

<color=#ffd780>About Regrator</color>
Oh, now that guy has a head full of grandiose plans fueled by raw ambition. I don't understand a word he says once he starts talking about his theories... Eh, but as long as he keeps our cash reserves stocked up, I'm not complaining.

customize.name: La Signora
customize.desc:
Signora, the Eighth of the Fatui Harbingers.
Unlike other Fatui who use the authority granted by Delusions, her Delusion is meant to shackle a flame that will devour everything. As opposed to a weapon used to kill, it might be more fitting to consider this a tool of imprisonment.
And it was the embers of that flame, which had accumulated over many long years, that would break through the frosty seal of the Delusion and apply a warped rouge upon her.

The crimson dawn was reflected in her pupils, and at last, she unfolded her flaming wings and flew towards the light.
"But that light is not the dawn, dear Rosalyne. That is a sea of flame that will consume everything."
A voice spoke to her amidst the light.

Yet it mattered not, for she knew in her heart that the flames had devoured her long ago.

customize.text: Tartaglia and Signora were previously both members of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers.

<color=#ffd780>About The Fair Lady</color>
I never got along with her, you know that. I guess there's not much more worth saying about her at this point. When you're a harbinger, you have to accept that death could come at any time... But don't worry about me. No matter what happens, I'll do whatever it takes to keep myself alive.

customize.name: Wanderer
customize.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

customize.text: Tartaglia and Wanderer were previously both members of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers.

<color=#ffd780>About The Balladeer</color>
After he took the Gnosis, we lost all contact with him. Now comes the task of trying to hunt it down and get it back... I actually don't mind it — it means I get to travel all over. Wonder if I'll run into you somewhere along the way?
<color=#ffd780>About Childe</color>
He's simple of mind and not that strong of body. Naming him to the lowest-ranked seat lowered the Harbingers' collective prestige. Thankfully, I'm no longer part of that group.

customize.name: Yelan
customize.desc: A mysterious person who claims to work for the Ministry of Civil Affairs, but is a "non-entity" on the Ministry of Civil Affairs' list.

customize.text: Tartaglia once unknowingly assisted Yelan in an investigation she was conducting.

<color=#ffd780>About Tartaglia</color>
The Fatui harbinger? He helped me out once — unwittingly. I was planning a deep-reaching investigation into the former owner of the Yanshang Teahouse, but our harbinger friend got to him first. He showed up demanding payment of his debt, and also exposed his accounting fraud, which got him thrown in jail. That made it very easy for me to take over Yanshang Teahouse myself, and it's proven to be a very useful base.

voice.title: Hello
voice.desc: I'm No. 11 of the Fatui Harbingers, codename Childe, but I also go by Tartaglia. And you... Hmm, you too like to cause quite the stir, don't you? Something tells me we're going to get along splendidly.

voice.title: Chat: Idleness
voice.desc: You know, there are better ways to seek out our enemies than... well, standing here.

voice.title: Chat: Test of Skills
voice.desc: This place is pretty dead... By which I mean, there's nothing to kill.

voice.title: Chat: The Fatui
voice.desc: I wonder what the rest of the Harbingers are up to? Plotting and scheming on an ever-grander scale, no doubt.

voice.title: Chat: Snezhnaya
voice.desc: Where I'm from, if we didn't keep moving, we'd freeze to death. Literally.

voice.title: After the Rain
voice.desc: Ah, perfect weather for fishing! The sound of the rain scares them away, but once it stops, they're yours for the taking.

voice.title: When It Snows: Foreign Country
voice.desc: Haha, ahh... could it be snowing in Snezhnaya too?

voice.title: When It Snows: Snezhnaya
voice.desc: The world looks glorious in the snow. Pure white, like the light of the moon. A perfect backdrop for bloodshed.

voice.title: When It's Windy
voice.desc: The wind is picking up. There is conflict in the air.

voice.title: When the Wind Is Blowing: Foreign Country
voice.desc: Just look at that wind blow!

voice.title: When the Wind Is Blowing: Snezhnaya
voice.desc: The wind permeates all, cleansing both mind and body. Excellent.

voice.title: Good Morning
voice.desc: Morning, comrade! You're raring to go today, I see.

voice.title: Good Afternoon
voice.desc: You look well. What's your secret? Care to exchange notes?

voice.title: Good Evening
voice.desc: Whew, dinner was quite the feast. A spot of exercise is in order.

voice.title: Good Night
voice.desc: Today was great. See you tomorrow, comrade!

voice.title: About Tartaglia
voice.desc: A warrior must always be ready to face any challenge with his blade. The outcome of the battle is irrelevant — what matters is that you learn from the experience.

voice.title: About Us: Comrades
voice.desc: Ah, I'm sure the Harbingers must know of my dealings with you by now. Oh, I'd love to see the look on their faces... Hahaha...

voice.title: About Us: Weapons
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6

I am the least adept with a bow. And that is precisely why I must master it.

voice.title: About Us: Survival
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6

You wield such powers without owning a Vision... I really am excited to see what you have in store for us... Let's see how far you can go. Just don't go dying on me before you lay it all on the line in our final battle! I won't allow it!

voice.title: About Us: Invitation
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6

Comrade, how would you like to join the Fatui? ...Actually, scrap that. With your capabilities, you and I could head-to-head with the Harbingers and win. Wouldn't want to miss an opportunity like that.

voice.title: About the Vision
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

If it makes me stronger, I'll take it. Vision? Great. Delusion? Don't mind if I do. Heretical teachings from the Abyss? Sign me up.

voice.title: Something to Share
voice.desc: The skeletal-white snowscape devours life without leaving any trace. It is the invisible enemy we fight against each day.

voice.title: Interesting Things
voice.desc: I once ventured deep into the abyss and came face-to-face with an enormous beast. I don't know its name, all I know is the sight of it chilled me to the bone. But mark my words, one day I will march back in there and behead that beast, and you, comrade, will be my witness!

voice.title: About Skirk
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

It's been years since I last saw my master. I should hope that next we meet, I'll at least be able to force her to use both hands to beat me...

voice.title: About Zhongli: Pondering
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

There's far more to that man than meets the eye. As for the extent of his power... lots to look forward to, I think.

voice.title: About Zhongli: Challenge
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Complete "A New Star Approaches"

Tell me, how has Mr. Zhongli been lately? Not bad, you say? Seems he's had no problem acclimating to "mortal" life. Hmph, he sure had me fooled. Such a fiasco mustn't be so easily forgiven! The only way to reconciliation is fierce combat! What do you mean I'm no match for him? Hahaha...

voice.title: About Tsaritsa
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Her Royal Highness the Tsaritsa is actually a gentle soul. Too gentle, in fact, and that's why she had to harden herself. Likewise, she declared war against the whole world only because she dreams of peace. And because she made an enemy of the world, I had the chance to become acquainted with you.

voice.title: About Varka
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Varka? Just the thought of one day going head-to-head with him in combat, the fabled Knight of Boreas himself, titan of the Knights of Favonius... It makes me buzz with excitement. It's a beautiful life we live in this world.

voice.title: About The Jester
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

He was the first ever Fatui Harbinger, and today he is our leader. He only appears on important occasions. As for his accomplishments... To be honest, I don't really care. I owe my loyalty and devotion to the Tsaritsa, no one else.

voice.title: About The Captain
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

I've seen him in battle before, and oh what a sight it was. Perhaps I'm ranked too low for him to notice me right now. Well, he may not recognize my strengths yet, but one day, I'll show him what I'm made of.

voice.title: About The Doctor
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

I heard that he took segments of himself at different ages, made prostheses out of them, and assigned different tasks to each one. I know... all my comrades are a little weird. Well, come to think of it, if I met another version of myself... Hah, we'd have to fight then and there to decide which one of us gets to survive.

voice.title: About Damselette
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

The Fatui Harbingers are ranked by strength, and I have no idea why that girl is No. 3. I'd test my skills with every Harbinger who ranks above me if I had the chance, but when it comes to her... something just doesn't feel right. Anyway, you should be careful around her.

voice.title: About The Knave
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Look, I've got nothing against people who have their own agendas - I myself joined the Fatui to get more experience in combat. But I don't like her at all. If she stood to benefit from betraying others, she'd turn against the Tsaritsa in a heartbeat. There isn't a sane bone in her body.

voice.title: About The Rooster
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

I don't know what his motivations could be, but he seems genuine about wanting to help me. He treats me just like family. Oh, and speaking of family - Tonia and Teucer are always telling me about the pastries and other gifts he brings them when they write. So while I've been away form Snezhnaya, he's kept his promise to take care of my family.

voice.title: About Marionette
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

She always seems engrossed in her research. Hmm... I wonder if those machines have anything to do with her? Anyway, I've only met her a few times, but every time she looked like she wanted to murder me. I have no idea what I possibly could have done to annoy her, though.

voice.title: About Regrator
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Oh, now that guy has a head full of grandiose plans fueled by raw ambition. I don't understand a word he says once he starts talking about his theories... Eh, but as long as he keeps our cash reserves stocked up, I'm not complaining.

voice.title: About The Fair Lady
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Complete "Omnipresence Over Mortals"

I never got along with her, you know that. I guess there's not much more worth saying about her at this point. When you're a harbinger, you have to accept that death could come at any time... But don't worry about me. No matter what happens, I'll do whatever it takes to keep myself alive.

voice.title: About The Balladeer
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

Complete "Omnipresence Over Mortals"

After he took the Gnosis, we lost all contact with him. Now comes the task of trying to hunt it down and get it back... I actually don't mind it - it means I get to travel all over. Wonder if I'll run into you somewhere along the way?

voice.title: More About Tartaglia: I
voice.desc: Remember, comrade, one day I will conquer the world!

voice.title: More About Tartaglia: II
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 3

Face me in person, man to man, and I'll always have a chance of beating you. Same goes if you're a deity or a monster from the abyss. But the Harbingers? They are more enamored with their intangible methods, spending their days scheming and maneuvering. This is why we cannot get along.

voice.title: More About Tartaglia: III
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4

However far away my motherland may be, we all live under the same sky. That snow-white moon... My family must be able to see it too. I hope my siblings are well... And I hope that they have turned out to be formidable warriors too.

voice.title: More About Tartaglia: IV
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 5

Comrade, a word of advice: Don't go yelling stupid things in the heat of battle. They might sound good in your head, but if you think about it, they make no sense at all. I'm talking about things like, "I'm on fire!" That's the last thing we want. Fire leaves behind nothing but ashes. And you must survive at all costs.

voice.title: More About Tartaglia: V
voice.desc:
Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6

Ah, how time flies. One day, you will see how I conquer the world and crush the thrones of gods beneath my heel. In the meantime... no dying, comrade! Keep yourself alive! Hahaha.

voice.title: Tartaglia's Hobbies
voice.desc: Ice fishing and combat follow the same principle. Patience and decisiveness are key. Though having said that... I suppose the same is true of everything in life.

voice.title: Tartaglia's Troubles
voice.desc: My pet peeves? Hmm, well, to be honest, I'm far too busy journeying with you and slaying powerful enemies to dwell on such trifling matters.

voice.title: Favorite Food
voice.desc: There's plenty of delicious food to sink your teeth into in this world... and plenty of fights to sink your teeth into as well. Life is beautiful.

voice.title: Least Favorite Food
voice.desc: Food is like weaponry. A true warrior never deliberates unduly over their choice of weapon, nor do they do so over the food they eat. Neither should you.

voice.title: Receiving a Gift: I
voice.desc: Eating delicious food really has a way of taking all your cares away. Now, how should I repay you?

voice.title: Receiving a Gift: II
voice.desc: Your cooking skills seems to have improved quite a lot. Does that mean you're getting stronger all the time, too?

voice.title: Receiving a Gift: III
voice.desc: Um, I'll admit the taste surprises me a little. Hmm? Okay... I'll try one more bite.

voice.title: Birthday
voice.desc: Happy birthday, comrade! Anyone you need knocked off their perch today? Let me know. I'll happily oblige...

voice.title: Feelings About Ascension: Intro
voice.desc:
Unlocks at ascension phase 1

Hohoho, I feel like I've gotten stronger! Now, who shall I use as my guinea pig...

voice.title: Feelings About Ascension: Building Up
voice.desc:
Unlocks at ascension phase 2

"A warrior's strength is like a dome. The bigger the dome, the more opponents he can challenge inside it." Hmm, who was it that said this again?

voice.title: Feelings About Ascension: Climax
voice.desc:
Unlocks at ascension phase 4

Bravo, comrade! Thanks to your help, I am one step closer to my goal of conquering the world. I doubt even the Tsaritsa herself ever expected I would make it this far.

voice.title: Feelings About Ascension: Conclusion
voice.desc:
Unlocks at ascension phase 6

Comrade. Make sure you keep training too. Otherwise, who will be left to fight me to the death when the world lies defeated at my feet? Hahaha.

voice.title: Elemental Skill: I
voice.desc: You're mine!

voice.title: Elemental Skill: II
voice.desc: Ha!

voice.title: Elemental Skill: III
voice.desc: Tidal wave!

voice.title: Elemental Skill: IV
voice.desc: Bring it on!

voice.title: Elemental Skill: V
voice.desc: Who's next?

voice.title: Elemental Skill: VI
voice.desc: Hah...

voice.title: Elemental Burst: I
voice.desc: Riptide!

voice.title: Elemental Burst: II
voice.desc: You can run, but you can't hide!

voice.title: Elemental Burst: III
voice.desc: Shouldn't let your guard down!

voice.title: Elemental Burst: IV
voice.desc: Brace yourself, this is gonna hurt!

voice.title: Sprint Start: I
voice.desc: No time to lose.

voice.title: Deploying Wind Glider: I
voice.desc: I could get used to this.

voice.title: Opening Treasure Chest: I
voice.desc: Alright, now we're talkin'!

voice.title: Opening Treasure Chest: II
voice.desc: Not bad... Not bad at all!

voice.title: Opening Treasure Chest: III
voice.desc: Now I just need to get my hands on the rest!

voice.title: Low HP: I
voice.desc: Heh, this is getting interesting.

voice.title: Low HP: II
voice.desc: You're pretty good!

voice.title: Low HP: III
voice.desc: Death looms. My time to shine!

voice.title: Ally at Low HP: I
voice.desc: What's the matter, out of practice?

voice.title: Ally at Low HP: II
voice.desc: Step aside, it's my turn!

voice.title: Fallen: I
voice.desc: How... I had only just...

voice.title: Fallen: II
voice.desc: Drat!

voice.title: Fallen: III
voice.desc: I'm... quite impressed...

voice.title: Heavy Hit Taken: I
voice.desc: Amateur mistake.

voice.title: Joining Party: I
voice.desc: Need to end a few enemies?

voice.title: Joining Party: II
voice.desc: Keep your eyes wide open!

voice.title: Joining Party: III
voice.desc: C'mon, don't keep me waiting!

desc.text: Decreases the CD of <color=#ffd780>Foul Legacy: Raging Tide</color> by 20%
When opponents affected by Riptide are defeated, Tartaglia regenerates 4 Elemental Energy.

Increases the Level of <color=#ffd780>Foul Legacy: Raging Tide</color> by 3.
Maximum upgrade level is 15.

If Tartaglia is in <color=#ffd780>Foul Legacy: Raging Tide</color> 's Melee Stance, triggers Riptide Slash against opponents on the field affected by Riptide every 4s, otherwise, triggers Riptide Flash.
Riptide Slashes and Riptide Flashes triggered by this Constellation effect are not subject to the time intervals that would typically apply to these two Riptide effects, nor do they have any effect on those time intervals.

Increases the Level of <color=#ffd780>Havoc: Obliteration</color> by 3.
Maximum upgrade level is 15.

When <color=#ffd780>Havoc: Obliteration</color> is cast in Melee Stance, the CD of <color=#ffd780>Foul Legacy: Raging Tide</color> is reset.
This effect will only take place once Tartaglia returns to his Ranged Stance.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Varunada Lazurite Sliver
materials.desc: Character Ascension Material.

materials.name: Starconch
materials.desc: Empty seashells brought ashore by the tides. Hold it close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.

materials.name: Recruit's Insignia
materials.desc: An insignia to identify the recruits. Makes one wonder about what the ones joining the Fatui's war machine were thinking.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Varunada Lazurite Fragment
materials.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains."

materials.name: Cleansing Heart
materials.desc:
A palmful of eternal water left by an oceanid.
Though it has already diffused among the depths of the lake, its purity remains all the same. But why would a creature so pure and clean as an oceanid covet the appearance of a being that roams the land, and assume such a form with pure water? They need not breathe nor do they require sustenance...

materials.name: Sergeant's Insignia
materials.desc: An insignia with a different shape to distinguish the sergeants from new recruits. Perhaps there are complicated emotions behind it.

Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains.
I must correct you. People here bear no sins in the eyes of the gods..."

materials.desc: An insignia to identify officers. The Fatui possess a colossal army, so there must be something extraordinary about the ones who achieved this rank within the group.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Varunada Lazurite Gemstone
materials.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"My ideals have no stains.
I must correct you. People here bear no sins in the eyes of the gods... Only laws and the Tribunal can judge someone.
They can judge even me. So praise my magnificence and purity."

imgDesc.text:
Original Outfit - Blades of Glory
Tartaglia's outfit. Illustrious attire that signifies Childe's position as the eleventh Fatui Harbinger.

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Normal Attack</color>
Perform up to 6 consecutive shots with a bow.
<color=#ffd780>Charged Attack</color>
Perform a more precise <color=#ffd780>Aimed Shot</color> with increased DMG.
While aiming, the power of Hydro will accumulate on the arrowhead. An arrow fully charged with the torrent will deal <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> and apply the Riptide status.
<color=#ffd780>Riptide</color>
Opponents affected by Riptide will suffer from <color=#80c0ff>AoE Hydro DMG</color> effects when attacked by Tartaglia in various ways. DMG dealt in this way is considered Normal Attack DMG.
· Riptide Flash: A fully-charged Aimed Shot that hits an opponent affected by Riptide deals consecutive bouts of AoE DMG. Can occur once every 0.7s.
· Riptide Burst: Defeating an opponent affected by Riptide creates a Hydro burst that inflicts the Riptide status on nearby opponents hit.
<color=#ffd780>Plunging Attack</color>
Fires off a shower of arrows in mid-air before falling and striking the ground, dealing AoE DMG upon impact.
When Tartaglia is in Foul Legacy: Raging Tide's Melee Stance, he cannot perform a plunging attack.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Teachings of Freedom
materials.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom to live is one of such. It is the freedom to live freely and healthily without concerns of one's own safety.

materials.name: Recruit's Insignia
materials.desc: An insignia to identify the recruits. Makes one wonder about what the ones joining the Fatui's war machine were thinking.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Guide to Freedom
materials.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
The freedom of travel is one of such. It is the freedom to traverse the land freely without being obstructed.

materials.name: Sergeant's Insignia
materials.desc: An insignia with a different shape to distinguish the sergeants from new recruits. Perhaps there are complicated emotions behind it.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Philosophies of Freedom
materials.desc:
Talent Level-Up material.
Freedom is the spirit of the land of the wind.
To sing is one such freedom. To sing on the land created by the Anemo Archon is to send your heart away with the song on the wind.

materials.name: Lieutenant's Insignia
materials.desc: An insignia to identify officers. The Fatui possess a colossal army, so there must be something extraordinary about the ones who achieved this rank within the group.

materials.name: Shard of a Foul Legacy
materials.desc:
The shard of a weapon that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is stained with a profound color that is not of this world, no doubt due to the land of endless darkness that the young boy saw with his own two eyes.
Perhaps it has nothing to do with the power of a Delusion, but as they say, the weapon reflects its user...

materials.name: Crown of Insight
materials.desc:
A precious Talent Level-Up material.
Once a medium for the storage and transfer of wisdom in ancient times. Now, wisdom is found in ancient texts and in profound speech. Nevertheless, this Crown of Insight must still be able to impart some transcendent power and wisdom to its bearer.

desc.text:
Unleashes a set of weaponry made of pure water, dealing <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> to surrounding opponents and entering Melee Stance.
In this Stance, Tartaglia's Normal and Charged Attacks are converted to <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> that cannot be overridden by any other elemental infusion and change as follows:
<color=#ffd780>Normal Attack</color>
Perform up to 6 consecutive <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> strikes.
<color=#ffd780>Charged Attack</color>
Consumes a certain amount of Stamina to unleash a cross slash, dealing <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> .
<color=#ffd780>Riptide Slash</color>
Hitting an opponent affected by Riptide with a melee attack unleashes a Riptide Slash that deals <color=#80c0ff>AoE Hydro DMG</color> . DMG dealt in this way is considered Elemental Skill DMG, and can only occur once every 1.5s.
After 30s, or when the ability is unleashed again, this skill will end. Tartaglia will return to his Ranged Stance and this ability will enter CD. The longer Tartaglia stays in his Melee Stance, the longer the CD.
If the return to a ranged stance occurs automatically after 30s, the CD is even longer.
He chose the bow as his weapon precisely to overcome his weakness with it. But a serious fight demands that he gets serious...

Performs different attacks based on what stance Tartaglia is in when casting.
<color=#ffd780>Ranged Stance: Flash of Havoc</color>
Swiftly fires a Hydro-imbued magic arrow, dealing <color=#80c0ff>AoE Hydro DMG</color> and applying the Riptide status.
Returns a portion of its Energy Cost after use.
<color=#ffd780>Melee Stance: Light of Obliteration</color>
Performs a slash with a large AoE, dealing massive <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> to all surrounding opponents, which triggers Riptide Blast.
<color=#ffd780>Riptide Blast</color>
When the obliterating waters hit an opponent affected by Riptide, it clears their Riptide status and triggers a Hydro Explosion that deals <color=#80c0ff>AoE Hydro DMG</color> .
DMG dealt in this way is considered Elemental Burst DMG.
Rushing waters are rarely seen in his snowy homeland. Perhaps his ability to command water is due to his understanding of just how precious it is.
Extends Riptide duration by 8s.
When Tartaglia is in <color=#ffd780>Foul Legacy: Raging Tide</color> 's Melee Stance, on dealing a CRIT hit, Normal and Charged Attacks apply the Riptide status effect to opponents.
Increases your own party members' <color=#ffd780>Normal Attack</color> Level by 1.

Despite holding one of the most senior positions in the Fatui as one of the Eleven Harbingers, Childe very much looks like the young adult that he still is.
He is a wolf in sheep's clothing, however, for under the cheerful and confident appearance lies a deadly swordsman.
He is the youngest among the Harbingers, but one of the most dangerous among their number.
That said, Childe doesn't seem to fit in well with the others.
As a fighter first and foremost, he is quite at odds with this organization of deceit and treachery.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 2</color>
As the youngest Harbinger in the history of the Fatui, Childe is hardly bound by convention, and plays by his own rules accordingly.
Though this lone wolf is not so well-received by his peers and is also at odds with their methods, his cavalier demeanor hides a responsible, watertight meticulousness.
He is a proud man of his word. Even if the promise he makes is absurd, he will never break it.
Be it exterminating all the dragons inside their lairs, venturing into a domain of extreme danger, or single-handedly overthrowing the territory of a nobleman...
He not only keeps his promises, but does so with finesse and surgical precision. As the Harbingers' vanguard, Childe always appears in the vulnerable underbellies of Snezhnaya's enemy states, striking as a conflict is about to erupt.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 3</color>
Many myths in Snezhnaya say that Tartaglia has been on the battlefield since he was 14 years old.
Oddly enough, at that young age he already seemed to be a skilled slaughterer with mastery of many forms of martial arts.
But more terrifying than his skill in combat was his passion for it.
Perilous battles would only excite him, and terrifying foes would exhilarate him all the more.
Childe's arrogance and conceit are derived from honing himself across countless battles, and from unmatched combat experience.
On the other hand, because they fret about the way his quarrelsome personality tends to invite unwanted trouble, the other Harbingers constantly try to get him sent on missions to places as far from Snezhnaya as possible, so that they can avoid the fallout.
The man is incomprehensibly ever in the eye of the storm, and these unusual experiences have also made him quite the show-off who revels in the praise of others.
Unlike other members of the Harbingers, who prefer to keep a low profile, Tartaglia will often go to watch public performances — occasionally even becoming part of the show himself.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4</color>
Ice fishing has been one of Tartaglia's hobbies since childhood.
In those days, he was known neither by the names Tartaglia nor "Childe," as the Fatui call him, but as Ajax, named by his father after some hero's tale. He and his father would cut holes open upon frozen lakes before sitting beside them and tending to their fishing lines.
This was no easy task, and would sometimes take the entire morning.
But whether it was chiseling away at the thick ice or the long waits in between catches, he was always accompanied by his father's unending tales of adventure.
These were stories of his father's adventures from when he was young, and they became the future that Tartaglia secretly envisioned for himself.
So he would pay close attention, putting himself into the shoes of the protagonist of those tales, immersing himself fully in them even as they waited for a fish to bite.
Even after leaving home, Ajax, later to be known as "Childe" Tartaglia, would keep up that hobby of his.
No longer accompanied by the stories of bygone days, fishing instead became an opportunity to train — to hone his endurance, and reflect on combat techniques.
Such long periods of meditation to refine his skills swiftly relegated the question of a successful catch to irrelevance.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 5</color>
Unlike what the rest of the world may think, Tartaglia was not born with his exceptional skills in battle.
But he would never speak to anyone about that critical, fateful encounter of his...
When he was 14, he fled his monotonous life at home with nothing but a shortsword and a bag of bread in hand.
That 14-year-old boy got lost in the snowy forest.
Pursued by bears and wolf packs, he lost his footing and fell into a bottomless crack in the earth's surface.
There, he witnessed the endless possibilities of another ancient world. There, he would meet a mysterious swordswoman...
Or perhaps one should say that this dark realm had sensed the burning ambition in this boy's heart.
This darkness was something that the Harbinger Childe could never again delve into.
In those three months, the swordswoman taught Tartaglia how to pass through the Abyss unhindered, and more importantly, nurtured the ability to stir up endless havoc from within Ajax's trouble-mongering nature.
No one knew what happened within that darkness during those three months, nor would Ajax ever speak of this to anyone.
When his worried mother and sisters finally found him in that forest, only 3 days had passed in this world.
Thus did Ajax's first adventure end, with his now-rusty shortsword in hand.
This would mark the end of his youth and the beginning of his days as a warrior.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6</color>
By the time he returned home, the young man was no longer the same.
He was no longer frightened and hesitant but had become frivolous and confident. He acted as if this world revolved around him, and as if battle existed for his sake.
Conflict often brings about change, and this capricious, incalculable change attracted Ajax like a revolving kaleidoscope.
In the eyes of his father, that third son that he had so worried about had changed for the worse, bringing much uncalled-for havoc to the seaside village of Morepesok.
Or perhaps it would be more accurate to say that Ajax had become a nexus of strife, for no matter where he went, fights and squabbles would follow — and he reveled in it.
Ultimately, after a huge brawl was pacified with some difficulty and with some near-fatal misses, his father had no choice but to hand his beloved son over for conscription into the Fatui.
He hoped that the strict military training of the Fatui could hone his son's temper, but wound up watching fully-armed troops getting the stuffing beaten out of them by a mere child.
This was a great disappointment to his father, but it also caught the attention of Pulcinella, the 5th Harbinger.
Shocked by Ajax's great strength and curious about how he invariably became the eye of a vortex of discord, Pulcinella inducted Ajax into the Fatui under the pretext of meting out punishment, ordering him to start from the bottom and take up the duty of serving the Tsaritsa.
His insatiable desire for conquest would thus be constantly satiated in fighting for the Fatui, and his ever-burgeoning ego would gorge upon the elation of vanquishing mighty foes...
Until at last, Ajax was chosen to be one of the Fatui Harbingers, donning the mantle of "Childe" Tartaglia and becoming one of the most powerful people in Snezhnaya.
But becoming Tartaglia was far from his end goal. To someone who sought to conquer the world, this was but a tiny step in his journey.

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 4</color>
"Dearest Sister, are you all keeping well at home? Has the old man's headache gotten any better?
Please send my regards to our parents and our siblings.
I've sent some wind chill medication over from Liyue Harbor. It's very effective, and will probably keep him from nagging for a while. It should reach you after a few days.
Apart from our father's affairs, I naturally haven't forgotten about gifts for you all.
This letter should come with two kites from Liyue, a rattle drum, two porcelain dolls from Inazuma, and a crate full of various snacks.
And please break it to Anthon that the residents of Liyue are just boring old ordinary humans, like us.
They're not made of stone, and they don't even eat stones.
Do not fret for my sake, Tonia, and refrain from making trouble for anyone at home. I will be home soon. When I have seized the seven stars of Liyue and laid them at the feet of Her Majesty the Tsaritsa, I will take the first ship home, just as I promised — and you know how I always keep my promises.
Yours faithfully, Your loyal knight."

<color=#ffd780>Unlocks at Friendship Lv. 6</color>
Tartaglia's Delusion is his old badge of honor and the proof of his strength.
He still remembers with perfect clarity the day when he received his Delusion and ascended to become a member of the Harbingers.
As he stood before the cold, stern Tsaritsa, The Jester, the very first of the Fatui, personally pinned this insignia onto him.
It was his reward for slaying many terrible beasts, and a memento of countless battles.
But it was not this that brought Tartaglia joy, for honor is the natural reward of the warrior.
Nor did he pay any mind to the odd looks his new "colleagues" gave him, for the opinions and bellyaches of others meant nothing to him.
The sight of the Tsaritsa on her lofty throne alone stirred the young man's heart with respect and admiration, not merely because she opened the way for him to find an abundance of looming battles, but also because of the way she looked upon him.
Her gaze was cold but pure, arrogant yet sharp.
She was not only the sacrosanct Cryo Archon but also a true warrior.
Thus did Childe, having received his Delusion, swear an oath of fealty to the one and only Tsaritsa of Snezhnaya.
